alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Coffey; Douglas; Franklin; Lyon; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 11:38PM CDT until July 05 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Franklin County in east central Kansas... Anderson County in east central Kansas... Southwestern Douglas County in east central Kansas... Southern Osage County in east central Kansas... Coffey County in east central Kansas... Southern Lyon County in east central Kansas... * Until 1245 AM CDT. * At 1137 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Pomona Lake to near Reading to 9 miles west of Emporia, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Emporia, Ottawa, Garnett, Burlington, Overbrook, Lyndon, Centropolis, Lebo, Pomona, Waverly, Olpe, Richmond, Colony, Williamsburg, New Strawn, Quenemo, Melvern, Hartford, Gridley and Greeley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 128 and 194. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 117 and 130. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Coffey; Douglas; Franklin; Lyon; Osage
